alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Canyon; Northern Carbon; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Red Lodge Foothills; Southeastern Carbon; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN BIG HORN...EASTERN CARBON AND SOUTH CENTRAL YELLOWSTONE COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM MDT... At 729 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Joliet to near Bridger. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bridger, Joliet, Fromberg, Pryor, and Edgar. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Canyon; Northern Carbon; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Red Lodge Foothills; Southeastern Carbon; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone
